Reviews.Title: “Really? Needs work.”
Reviews.Author: MrSkully
Reviews.Content: Got here at 1:30PM told I had to wait till 3PM to check in, there is 3 checking parking spots and one was fill all day by an employee. The drains are very slow, the tub water will fill to above your ankles when in the shower and the toilet does not flush all the way. Caution in rm 121 as the microwave will burn your stuff. The room was Ok, just could of been cleaned better and the plumbing needs work bad....

Reviews.Title: “Loud &Unclean”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in lots of Super 8s, so we weren't expecting the Ritz or anything, but quite honestly they're usually a decent room at a great price. Not this time. The room was dirty (there was "stuff" embedded in the walls in the bathroom, and I'm just not gonna speculate on what it was), and the walls must have been less than an inch thin. We could hear every "conversation" the loud guy next door had with his bratty kids, and every morning it sounded like the maids were working with heavy equipment right outside our door. Nothing like 2-3 hours of off-and-on sleep to start each vacation day off right! I still think Super 8s can be a good deal - but steer clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: “I think someone was murdered in #219”
Reviews.Author: Raimund K
Reviews.Content: We were in town from Denver on business and just needed a place for one night so we thought, "Why not Super 8?" The experience answered that question. We needed four single rooms total. When first walking into the lobby we were told they could accommodate us. After a few minutes of deciding where to stay we went back in and were told they only had one single available. We negotiated and were able to get doubles for the price of a single. All of us got our room keys, and proceeded to get baggage out of the rental car. 3/4 of the keys didn't actually unlock any doors, and we were told it was due to being too close to electronics. The one key that did work had 115 written on it. We open the door to 115, there is luggage open on the beds and the shower is running. (Good thing we didn't catch a glance) Returned to office and told them of the situation and she said, "Sorry, were doing training and you were supposed to get 215." The lock to another one of our rooms still wouldn't unlock. They switched that room to 219. Our manager was uncomfortable with having an adjoining room to another room where we didn't know someone. So we switched 215 to 220. After driving 13 hours to Peoria, we all were in need of rest. After waking we found the towels were dirty, there were cigarette burns in a non-smoking room, and upon close inspection there was blood splatter on the walls, carpet, and curtains. The security latch in 219 was also separating from the door. The drain and stopper were missing from the bathtub. The grout in the bathroom looks like it hasn't been scrubbed since the place was built. There was a coffee pot, but no coffee. I told the attendant in the office about our experience at checkout and she said, "Well you should have came down first thing to let us know about the problem." I'm sorry but after driving for half a day I'm not going to inspect our room, go down to the office, and have them switch the room once again.. But I guess next time I know. Not that next time we will stay at the Super 8. Not to mention it was hard to sleep because they have a 24 hour maintenance team doing more talking than working in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe,Dirty, Dangerous”
Reviews.Author: nofear2222
Reviews.Content: Was greeted by a "securityguard" to attempted check us in.He was a dodgy looking character with a 14" blade strapped to his hip.We had problems with our booking and was told not to hang around outside the room.There was something dodgy going on in the carpark.Dodgy people hanging around,random vehicles coming in and out looking to be up to no good.And then there were the rooms.Disgusting! stunk,bathroom was dirty bed sheets were dirty and had burn marks and then we found both beds to contain bed bugs and dog hairs.i couldnt bring myself to stay there so just uppd nd left without even wasting time asking for my money back.The comfort inn 3 miles up is only $25 more and is safe,friendly and really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, run....!”
Reviews.Author: 09Kiska09
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and everything looked good until we went to bed. After 10 minutes in bed, I got an itch on my eye. I thought it was weird. When we put the lights on, we saw 4 bed bugs on the bed. We have it immediately reported to the reception and got a new room, but had no sleep anumore.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for convention and visting Pheonix”
Reviews.Author: mkm1013
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a convention and then some time to explore the Phoenix area. The staff was exceptionally helpful, especially with shipping several large packages to and from the motel. The room was very clean. The breakfast was standard fare, but the coupon in the room led to a great pizza delivery - ordered three times. It is a very convenient location to the airport and to downtown, and the room rate was very good. There is a wonderful Mexican restaurant three blocks east. The area doesn't seem like much, but I felt safe making the 10-15 minute walk to the convention center each day. At the end of the week, we drove up to Sonora and out to Globe visting lots of ruins and historical attractions. A great working vacation. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal”
Reviews.Author: 1sunseeker99
Reviews.Content: We know you get what you pay for so we were not expecting much. The room was dirty, the shower had mold due to a leaking faucet. We could deal with that, but when someone gets into your room while your gone and takes a number of personal belongings, you need to go somewhere more secure. When we told management, we were accused of making up the story to get a better rate. When we tried to check out because we didn't feel safe there, we were charged an extra $40.00 for a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: heatlamp
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit disappointing. Based on reviews in this forum we spent two nights here to take in some Cactus league games. The location was convenient. No problem checking in, the room (a suite) was very large: actually two normal rooms with two bathrooms, two TV's, small fridge. King beds huge and comfortable. There were some problems. Two lights in the room did not work, one shower did not work, and the rooms, while certainly not really dirty, were not as clean as one might hope. Neither bathroom had tissues. There were a couple of small pieces of TP in one bathroom floor, a bottle cap on the floor in the bathroom, and the last occupant's cell phone charger was still plugged in. The room was quiet except for late night partying by a group by the pool just outside our window. A/C and heat worked fine. This room was away from the freeway had no freeway noise. The breakfast was standard fare for a hotel in this class. Part of the problem here may be that new owners are not up to speed, but in any event I'll probably look elsewhere next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Manager can not perform her duties as expected”
Reviews.Author: hugo38
Reviews.Content: I was there 2 times this year. unfortunately, the last time I forgot a personal item, after many calls to The Manager, I have been unable to get item shipped to me. Can some one else Help ? ? ?

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: gottatravelVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, was looking forward to it with the good reivews, but we had a completely different experience. The palce was rundown. No snacks except stale popcorn in the lobby. Our room was very dirty, black hairs on the blankets, danky smell, Put water through the coffee maker for tea adn it came out brown, toilet had urine on it, bathrrom sink faucets were dirty, no bath mat in the bathroom, etc etc.. We are not clean freaks by any means, but this place was pretty shabby and divey. You sign a waiver that you wnt' smoke int eh room, but the peopel inteh roomnext to use, regularly were coming out of hteir room with a lit cigarette in hand. We listened to them party until the wee hours. Breakfast was basic, no sausages, but they did have waffles. Pool was nice, but spa was closed. They have a bbq by the pool, but who wants to eat in a smelly dark room with no utensils or plates? Next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and secluded”
Reviews.Author: kilrblue
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for one night in early June and again in mid July. This has become "our" motel. We found the staff helpful and curtious, the room was clean and well furnished (including a microwave, refidgerator, flatscreen TV and new coffee machine). Most of all the location really appeals to us. The overall landscaping is very nice. We live in Phoenix and were quite surprised to find trees and green grass. The pool and jacuzzi are amazing at night. The location provides privacy and quiet, yet still very close to dining and night life, something rather hard to find in Phoenix. I would recommend this establishment to couples for a "staycation".The price is unbeatable for the location and amenities provided. We had a wonderfully memorable stay here and plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: metal02
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel a few times usually around the holidays and plan to again very soon. They are no longer a Best Western, which its about time because I disliked other BW I stayed at. This Hotel is clean and has some awesome ammenities. Great breakfast in the mornings and snacks all day long. Loved the free wireless internet that even worked pool side.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: pin_dizzle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel. I wanted to changed rooms because of smoking preference and the phone was not working. They said I had to change rooms immediately and give me no time to pack my stuff. I need more time. Instead of giving me more time they told me I had to leave. They called the police and I was escorted out. My stuff was left outside the door. My friend came to grab it and the security guard grabbed my stuff and threw it at my friend's face. They staff isrude and they dont respect you or your property.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: JustVisitin
Reviews.Content: We arrived after dark and after a long drive, staying only because it was freeway close. This location is near an industrial community and has very few local ammenities which would have been a turnoff had we the time to drive around and survey the immediate area. Our first disturbing encounter was at around 10:00 pm. We were doing a load of laundry and 2-3 tough looking guys drinking beer began banging on the glass security door and asking my wife to "open the door." She fled in the opposite direction and we did the laundry the following day. Early the next morning while preparing to leave, I noticed at least one vehicle up on jacks and the motor being overhauled. Around the near corner of the building, they had rented out a room to some temporary employment agency who was interviewing quite a few day laborers. And finally, a van was parked in the far corner and picked up a few "shady ladies" that appeared to have spent the night. After this experience, I can not recommend this location to a travelling family. To repeat another from review... "The room smelled somewhat musty and moldy, and the external hallways in the vicinity of my room were in disrepair with large gaps, and insulation and nails, being visible from the ceiling... I think this is a medium level economy hotel", and worthy of a medium level ranking at the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel!”
Reviews.Author: derekUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Great motel, great location, great city! Stayed 3 nights in April, great park outside your room parking, has everything inc properly heated pool! Nice sized rooms with fridge & microwave!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderfool
Reviews.Content: I spent the same for 2 nights in this motel as I did for 1 night in Sedona and the room was essentially the same. The pool was even open in this motel! The room was clean, the beds comfortable, the shower pressure good. The coffee pot took a little while to figure out, but it worked fine. The location was north of Phoenix, which was great for our purposes. We were coming down from the Grand Canyon and Sedona. The front desk was very friendly. The morning breakfast was ok. There was sausages, boiled eggs, cereal, apples/oranges, juice and bread for toast. Watch that toaster! It burned someone's bread one morning and the whole room was full of smoke. There's one computer in the lobby for free guest internet use, so I was able to print off my boarding passes on check out day. I think this motel is hit or miss. While I was on the computer, a gentleman was checking out with numerous issues: his heat, telephone and plumbing didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: bkifan
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for bells and whistles, this is not your place. We stayed in a nonsmoking room and it was fine. I will note that our friends were in a smoking room and you could definitely tell. But, what do you expect? Our room was clean, but outdated, and the bathroom was very small. However, we weren't in the room much so it wasn't bad. The pool area was nice and clean. The fuse in our room kept blowing and we constantly lost power to the fridge but we lived with it. The continental breakfast was quite nice, and I found the front desk personnel nice as well. For the price, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: midnightblues
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely not a top 20 hotel in the Phoenix area in my opinion... I've stayed at about 12 different Arizona hotels since June due to my job, and this is probably one of the two hotels I'd rank last... The room smelled somewhat musty and moldy, and the external hallways in the vicinity of my room were in disrepair with large gaps, and insulation and nails, being visible from the ceiling... I can't figure out how this hotel could get a top 20 ranking in the Phoenix area, unless certain of the previous reviews are bogus... I think this is a medium level economy hotel, and worthy of a medium level ranking of all Phoenix hotels.... It could definitely be worse, but it certainly is no better than average, so how it managed a top 20 ranking in Phoenix is beyond me. and at least in my opinion, the top 20 ranking is extremely misleading.... Although I was disappointed with the physical accomodations, I do want to say that the young ladies at the front desk were extremely friendly and accomodating, and I found no fault with them..

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick78
Reviews.Content: Used this as a stop between San Diego and the Grand Caynon. Used pool, clean rooms, right on off and on ramp for express way.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless internet at the pool...Great!”
Reviews.Author: ACCali
Reviews.Content: I recently took a working vacation in Phoenix. I had a couple of meetings to attend there so we took the whole family with us. This hotel was absolutely wonderful. I was able to access their wireless internet not only in my room but also at the pool. It was great to be able to spend the extra time with my family while I worked. The staff were kind and helpful. The manager went out of her way to help me get on line to do my work. I can't say enough kind things about this hotel. I definitely recommend it to anyone going to Phoenix whether it be for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Beds & Dog Area”
Reviews.Author: DTrieco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bell Hotel for a week in June 2006 while my father was in the hospital. I upgraded to a pillow-top mattess which was even more comfortable than my bed at home. I had no trouble connecting to the wireless high speed internet (which the front desk staff gladly lent me a wireless card to access) and could even connect to the internet in the pool area. My Burmese Mountian Dog (all 85 pounds of her) was welcome and there was a long grassy area for her to exercise. This is now my hotel of choice for visits to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The Customer is always wrong”
Reviews.Author: JNAT
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled across the country, and this was by far the worst hotel that I stayed in. The hotel itself was fine, but the manager and staff were extremely argumentative and forced me to stay here against my will. When I checked in, I looked for the hi speed internet that was promised me when I made reservation. When I noticed there was not a connection, and having private internet was important for me that evening, I asked if I could just cancel my room, move on, and not be charged. I did this immediately upon checking in and going to my room. At first, they told me since I used expedia, that they could not refund my money. I pointed out that I did not use expedia, and showed them my printout from Best Western[--]. They still said they would charge me whether I stayed or left. This was definitely Worst Western.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dollar for dollar, bang for buck, this is the best place to stay. This is the third time I've gone to Phoneix and the only place I'll stay. The rooms were clean, the staff very friendly. The free continental breakfast was great. Eating breakfast with fellow travelers was the one thing I liked most. Sitting outside in the morning was a good way to start the day. I felt it wasn't just a room, but I had other places to go and walk around,taking our small dog for walks as well. To me, considering all the other Hotels in Phoenix, this is the best overall Hotel you can stay ... Best Value.

Reviews.Title: “Paid less then expected for quality of room & service”
Reviews.Author: Neil-trip
Reviews.Content: Great Value. I would have paid much more for night stay at this Best Western for quality of room and service provided. I think the rates are higher for their busy season but still Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when travelling through the US. A very nice hotel, close to the highway but our room was far away from the highway. Nice swimming pool, we had a lucky day with 30 degrees celsius temperature so we spend some time at the pool. Shops are close to the hotel so you can get some food and put it in the microwave in the hotel. They accepted our discount-coupon so it was a cheap-night for us.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 17211 North Black Canyon Hwy, Phoenix, AZ 85023
